objects.name: Analytic 1552
objects.description: Linux environmental validation behavioral chain: (1) Intensive system enumeration through command execution (uname, hostname, ifconfig, lsblk, mount), (2) File system reconnaissance targeting specific paths, network configurations, and installed packages, (3) Process and user enumeration to validate target environment characteristics, (4) Conditional script execution or binary activation based on environmental criteria, (5) Network connectivity validation and external IP address resolution for geolocation verification

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: auditd:PROCTITLE
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: command-line execution patterns for system discovery utilities (uname, hostname, ifconfig, netstat, lsof, ps, mount)

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: linux:syslog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: authentication and authorization events during environmental validation phase

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Linux commands commonly used for system reconnaissance - customize based on environment-specific discovery patterns
Number of discovery commands within time window indicating reconnaissance burst - tune based on legitimate administrative activity
File paths and system properties commonly validated by environmental keying - adapt to organizational infrastructure
Normal network discovery activity patterns to distinguish from malicious reconnaissance
Script patterns and conditional logic indicating environment-based execution decisions
